feed.title: SAP Community - SD (Sales and Distribution)
feed.subtitle: SD (Sales and Distribution) Q&A in SAP Community

entry.title: Quantity-Based Discount Configuration in SD
entry.content:
My customer has requested a quantity-based discount as described below. Could you please advise how to configure the appropriate condition type in SD? 

  • Unit Price: USD 1,000 (Total 20 units will be delivered per month) * Note : The customer requested to be displayed this unit price at the order entry level. 

  • Discount Structure:

    • Delivery quantity from 1 to 60 units: USD 100 discount per unit

    • Delivery quantity from 61 to 120 units: USD 50 discount per unit

Thank you in advance for your support.

entry.title: Delivery weight not being pulled through from Sales order
entry.content:
We have a situation where weights are being pulled from the material master to the sales order as normal but when creating the outbound delivery from the sales order the weight is not pulling through.  I have checked and the weight relevant is ticked in the item cat. 

Why would the weight not pull through from the sales order as normal? 

Note using SAP ECC

entry.title: "Parking Lot" for approval of Sales Order Workflows
entry.content:
We have implemented flexible workflow for sales documents in On premise S4HANA and its working well.

We have a requirement to “park” approvals for certain sales documents. There are sales documents which are created and immediately blocked for further processing (using the standard workflow process).

The customer will request delivery of the sales order at a later stage which could be weeks after it was created. We would like a process by which the orders the customer has requested for delivery are submitted for approval i.e. they are sent to the inbox of the approver.

Currently the order is immediately sent to the approver and sits in the inbox of the approver until an email is sent to approve the order which sort of defeats the purpose of automation. It also raises the risk of orders being approved in error and just clogging the inbox of the approver with orders which are not yet relevant for approval.

I just wanted to get the thoughts of others of how this process can be implemented.

entry.title: Customer consignment process in SAP S4HANA with EWM and TM
entry.content:
Hi All,

I have  a question regarding consignment process, we create a sales order followed by delivery creation and good issue with movement type 631. In real time scenarios how the real consumption is posted from customer ?  and how this action of consumption is posted in S4HANA?, i.e. system automatically created a sales order with logical outbound delivery and performs goods issue?

Can somebody clarify this point from business and technical point of view?

Thank you!

entry.title: Upadating VBFA Entries
entry.content: I have some mismatched entries in VBFA table where I wanted to update RFMNG_FLO field based on RFMNG. What can be a better approach of doing it?

entry.content:
Hi Sir/Madam

I just want to know if there is a any standard functionality in SAP  to upload data from excel to any of the database tables. I am on S4HANA 2023 version

Thanks

entry.title: Hi Experts, I need to know what the exact number that follows KOTE, if I only have the value KNUMA
entry.content:
Hi Experts,

In which table the rebate agreement number is stored?  I know that the agreement number stored is in KOTE****, but my question is that How can I know the exact number that follows KOTE, if I only have the value of KONA-KNUMA?

Many Thanks

entry.title: The third-party procurement process in DBM system
entry.content:
Does the parts sales process of the DBM system support the third-party procurement process?

Aftermarket modification parts are purchased on a per-vehicle basis. At present, we don't have this process in our DBM system. We want to implement this process.

How can I do ？

entry.title: Delivery group functionality in Sales order item level is not Working.
entry.content:
Hi Experts,

I am working on public cloud 2502, I have created Sales order with 4 line items and 1st 2 line items delivery group value is 1 and rest 2 line items have delivery group (VBAP-GRKOR) value is 2. Based on values when i tried to create outbound delivery, system should create two outbound deliveries but system is creating single outbound delivery and not considering delivery group (VBAP-GRKOR) field value in delivery split.

Please help if any has faced this issue and fixed it.

Regards

XXXX

entry.title: Delivery Creation date VL10
entry.content:
Hi everyone,

 

I’m encountering a problem while creating a Delivery Note (DN) using VL10. In the Delivery Schedule of the STO, both the "Material Available Day" and "Transport Plan Day" are  15.08.2025. However, when I enter 15.08.2025 as the "Delivery Creation Date" in VL10 and execute the transaction, no items eligible for DN creation appear.

 

Strangely, if I adjust the condition to "less than or equal to 15.08.2025", the eligible items do appear, and I can create the DN normally. Conversely, if I set the condition to "less than or equal to 14.08.2025", no eligible items show up again.

 

I would appreciate it if you could help clarify this issue. Thank you!

 

Best regards

entry.title: Function Module Product_List_Exclusion does not consider only Listing
entry.content:
Hi All

We have a requirement to check if there are any records in a listing procedure for a Sales Org / Customer. We were trying to use the SAP function Module PRODUCT_LIST_EXCLUSION. We used the FM and passed the parameters in the Header structure with no details in the Item. We also passed the Listing procedure in the field for SCHEME. However, the FM does not read the Listing procedure and does not provide a feedback that record exists. We verified that there are records in listing condition type in the listing procedure specified in the FM but we do not get the required result.

Any expert inputs on the use of the FM ? 

Appreciate your help

Regards

Rohit Zalani

Kindly please check and help on this.

I have give you the test cases in Q10 system for multiple deliveries.

72975754

72975755

72975756

72975757

Even i have checked payer and incoterms also for all deliveries we are having single sales order with same material.

In VTFL Maintain Data VBRK/VBRP as 604.

entry.title: How to remove a Billing Plan line item from Sales Order?
entry.content:
Dears,
How can I remove a Billing Plan line item (added e.g. by mistake)? There is no button for that, and the item is also not removed after deleting the Date description and Billing type, see the attached screenshot.

Any ideas? 

P.S. Such line items are shown in the custom report where all the Billing Plan line items should be displayed (incl. blocked ones) but not the one I mentioned - that one will not be used/billed and should be removed.  
System version: SAP ECC 6.0 Enh Pack 5

Regards
Krzysztof

entry.title: FIORI Sales order creation Version vs. GUI VA01
entry.content:
Hello SCN,

unfortunately, I was not able to find the corresponding clue on this.

Why is the behavior in Sales Order Management – Version 2, or when navigating to "Create Sales Order" [not the VA01- GUI], so different?

When I start via F3893 → "New Sales Order," I noticed the following differences:

  • No pop-up for material substitution

  • No pop-up for “partial confirmation” or availability check

Did I click something wrong, or is this really the case?

Is there a list of the differences?

Thanks!

entry.title: How Other VAT Reg. No. is determined in Billing?
entry.content:
We have a few other VAT registration numbers defined for a customer in the 'Control data' tab -> 'Other' button. The main VAT number is DE... (KNA1-STCEG), and the others are NL... and FR... (KNAS-STCEG), see the attached screenshot. There are no different addresses for the NL and FR registrations, confirmed with FI.

How can these additional VAT numbers be determined in the standard sales process (and finally in Billing, VBRK-STCEG)? Especially since we don’t need extra addresses or redundant master data for Ship-to - that’s why VAT numbers for registration in other countries are defined as 'Others'. Is there an option to select a different destination country or a specific VAT number in the sales document for such cases? 

Regards
Krzysztof

entry.title: Skipping popup messages in VA03 for Sales Order Incompletion Logs
entry.content:
When I open any Sales Order in VA03 then popup messages related to Sales Order incompletion log are coming. For few Sales Orders, the incompletion logs are in large number and user has to click many times to close those popup messages. 

I have analysed and found a SAP NOTE 1459252 which is suggesting to create a custom program to delete the table entries from VBUV table which are having Sales Order overall status(VBAK-GBSTK) as completed (‘C’) or initial(' '). But, I want to confirm that, is deleting the records from SAP standard table i.e. VBUV table safe? 

Is there any other alternative to achieve the requirement i.e. to open a Sales Order by skipping the popup messages for Incompletion logs?

Thanks in advance.

entry.title: SD document 212345 is not in the database or has been archived - FOR Specific Material
entry.content:
Hello Experts,

Our system does not create the sales order when the user enters a specific material and presses the save button. The system gives a success message saying "Standard order 212345 has been saved". But when we look at the sales order in VA03,  the system error says "SD document 212345 is not in the database or has been archived". 

Please note that this issue happens only when we enter the specific material item, not the other material.

I have compared the material master with other good materials. It doesn't have issues. 

Can you please advise if anyone has come across this issue?

Thanks in Advance,

Regards,

Rajpal

entry.title: Business partner 2288 already existsMessage no. R1286
entry.content:
Hello community

Business Scenario
During the ECC to SAP ERP 6.0 EHP8 conversion project, we are executing the Customer-Vendor Integration (CVI) activities.

Both Customers and Vendors have been historically maintained with the same external number range (ZZ: 0000000001 – 0000009999).
The same external number range has also been defined for Business Partners (ZZ: 0000000001 – 0000009999) 

In the direction BP ↔ Customer/Vendor, the mapping was configured so that identical numbers should be used across BP, Customer, and Vendor.

Current Issue
The CVI Cockpit (CVI_COCKPIT) was executed successfully for Vendors.

For Vendor 2288, a Business Partner 2288 was created and linked (entry exists in table CVI_VEND_LINK).

However, when attempting to synchronize Customers with the same number (2288), the system raises the following errors:

Business partner 2288 already exists

Message no. R1286

When trying to extend the existing BP manually in transaction BP with the Customer role (FLCU00), the system does not allow saving because the Customer key already exists in KNA1/KNB1.

The following error is issued:
Customer data was not saved due to error CVI_MAPPING 042; see long text

Message no. CVI_BDT_ADAPTER050

Problem Statement


Due to the identical number ranges, when trying to synchronize Customers, the system fails because the BP number already exists and is linked to the Vendor.

Manual maintenance in BP is also blocked, as the Customer number already exists in KNA1/KNB1.

How can we solve this problem?

 

Thanks in advance

entry.title: Automatic Batch/Serial No Determination in vl01n
entry.content:
Hi Everyone,

 

We are automating batch and serial number determination during outbound delivery.

  • Batch should be determined automatically.

  • Serial numbers (received from a third-party system and stored in a custom table) should be assigned automatically when navigating to Extras → Serial Numbers.

For batch determination, I found the exit USEREXIT_BATCH_DETERMINATION.
Could you please suggest which exit or BAdI can be used for automatic serial number assignment?

Is there any Other ways to approach this requirement?

entry.title: Can Flexible Workflow Handle Multi-Level CMR Approvals by Amount as standard functionality?
entry.content:
We need to implement a multi-level approval process for Credit Memo Requests (CMR) based on the request amount. For example:

  • CMR below €1,000 requires approval from Level 1 and Level 2.

  • CMR between €1,000 and €2,000 requires approval from Level 1, Level 2, and Level 3.

Since SAP standard does not allow the request creator to be an approver, can we configure this hierarchy using standard Flexible Workflow functionality, or would customization be necessary? 

If customization is necessary, can someone please summarize - what needs to be done?
